util¶

feebee.util.add_date(date, n)¶

n means days for “%Y-%m-%d”, months for “%Y-%m”. Supports only 2 fmt.

feebee.util.chunk(rs, n, column=None)¶
Usage:
chunk(rs, 3) => returns 3 rows about the same size
chunk(rs, [0.3, 0.4, 0.3]) => returns 3 rows of 30%, 40%, 30%
chunk(rs, [100, 500, 1000], ‘col’)
=> returns 4 rows with break points 100, 500, 1000 of ‘col’
feebee.util.isnum(*xs)¶

Tests if x is numeric

feebee.util.lag(cols, datecol, ns, add1fn=None, max_missings=10000)¶

create columns for lags and leads, ex) col_1, col_2n

feebee.util.listify(x)¶

Attempt to turn it into a list if possible if not return as is

feebee.util.readxl(fname, sheets=None, encoding='utf-8', delimiter=None, quotechar='"', newline='\n')¶

Reads excel like files and yields a list of values

feebee.util.where(pred, fn=None)¶

Filter with pred before you apply fn to a list of rows. if fn is not given, simply filter with pred
